gurmukhi: Dn isMG sYnw jwdvI dInI GnI Kpwie ] qb biRjBUKn kop Bir bolXo nYn qcwie ]1107]
transliteration: Dhan Singh Sainaa Jaadavideenighanikhapaae|| Tab Brij-bhookhan Kop Bhar(i) Bolyo Nain Tachaae||1107||
translation: Dhan Singh destroyed much of the Yadava army, then Krishna highly infuriated and gaping his eyes wide open, said;1107.
Speech of Krishna addressed to the army:

gurmukhi: dyKq ho Bt TwFy khw hm jwnq hY qum paurK hwrXo ] sRI Dn isMG ky bwn CutY sBhUM rn mMfl qy pg twrXo ]
transliteration: Dekhat Ho Bhat Thaadhe Kahaa Ham Jaanat Hai Toum Paurakh Hdaryo|| Sridhan Singh Ke Baan Chhoutai Sabh-hoon Ran Mandal Te Pag Tdaryo||
translation: “O brave warriors ! Why are you standing? I know that you lost your courage; you began to recede your feet from the battlefield, when Dhan Singh discharged his arrows,

gurmukhi: isMG kY AgÍ jYsy Ajwgn AYsy Bjy nih SsqR sMBwrXo ] kwier huie iqh pyK fry nih Awp mry aun kau nhI mwrXo ]1108]
transliteration: Singh Kai Agrav Jaise Ajaagad Aise Bhaje Nah(i) Shastra Sanbhdaryo|| Kaair Hue Tih Pekh Dare Nah(i) Aap Dare Oun Kau Nahimdaryo||1108||
translation: “And becoming careless about your weapons you ran in such a way as a gathering of goats runs away before the lion; you have become cowards and have been frightened on seeing him; you have neither died yourselves nor have killed him.”1108.

gurmukhi: XoN suinkY hir kI bqIXwN Bt dwNqn pIs kY kRoD Bry ] Dnu bwn sMBwr kY Dwie pry Dn isMG huqy nhI nYku fry ]
transliteration: Yon Soun(i)kai Har(i) Bateeyaan Bhat Daantan Pees Kai Krodh Bhare|| Dhan(u) Baan Sanbhaar Kia Dhaae Dare Dhan Singh Houte Nahinaik(u) Dare||
translation: Hearing these words of Krishna, the warriors began to gnash their teeth in great anger and without fearing Dhan Singh, even slightly, they took out their bows, arrows and fell upon him;

gurmukhi: Dn isMG srwsn lY kir my kit dYqn ky isr BUm pry ] mno paun ko puMj bhXo lg ky PulvwrI my tUt kY PUil Jry ]1109]
transliteration: Dhan Singh Saraasan Lai Kar(i) Me Kattee Daitan Ke Sir Bhoom Dare|| Mano Paoun Ko Pounj Bahyo Lag Ke Phulvaarime Toot Kai Phool(i) Jdare||1109||
translation: Dhan Singh also took out his bow and arrows in his hand and from the other side, because of the attack of the Yadava army, the heads of the demons, being chopped, fell on the earth like the flowers deopping down in the garden by the blowing of fierce wind

gurmukhi: kop Bry Awey Bt igry rn BUm kit ju`D ky inpt smuhwie isMG Dn so ] AwXuD lY pwn mY indwn ko smr jwn daur daur pry bIrqw bFwie mn mo ]
transliteration: Kop Bhare Aae Bhat Gire Ran Buoom Kattee Juddh Ke Nipat|| Samuhaae Singh Dhan So|| Ooyudh Lai Paan Mai Nidaan Ko Sadare Jaan Daur Daur Dare Beertaa Badhaae Man So||
translation: The warriors came in great anger and being chopped began to fall in front of Dhan Singh, while fighting with him; holding their bows and arrows in their hands, they came running before him in heroic vein, considering it a decisive war;

gurmukhi: kop Dn isMG lY srwsn subwn qwn judo kr fwry sIs iqnhI ky qn so ] mwnhu bsuMDrw kI DIrqw inhwr ieMdR kInI inj pUjw AiribMd puhpn so ]1110]
transliteration: Kop Dhan Singh Lai Saraasan Soubaan Taan Judo Kar Ddare Sees Tinhike Tan So|| Maanoh Basoundharaa Kidheetraa Nihaar Indra Keeninij Poojaa Ar(i)bind Puhpan So1110||
translation: Dhan Singh also being highly infuriated, taking his bow and arrows in his hand, he separated their heads form their trunks; it seemed that seeing the power of endurance of the earth, Indra was worshipping it, offering it flowers.1110.

gurmukhi: sRI Dn isMG AXoDn my Aiq kop kIXo bhuqy Bt mwry ] Aaur ijqy br Awvq hy su jnu mwrq myG ibfwry ]
transliteration: Sridhan Singh Ayodhan Me At(i) Kop Keeyo Bahoute Bhat Mdare|| Aur Jite Bar Aavat He Su Jan(u) Maarat Mehg Biddare||
translation: Dhan Singh in extremen anger in the war killed many warriors; others who came in front of him, he destroyed them all just as the clouds are fragmented by the blow of wind instantly;
